Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Template Designer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-7)

## Introduction
This chapter explains the use of *Dynamic Values*. A *Dynamic Value *is a field reference to a value in the data source. In order to use dynamic data, some basic understanding of XML (Extensible Markup Language), XSD (XML Schema Definition) and XPath is necessary. *Doxee Template Designer *offers, besides the simple *Dynamic Value *functionality, various other elements for dynamic use. Dynamic elements are easily recognised by their blue colour.

## Step by Step
In order to be able to work through the following task you need an XML sample file. We provide a sample file in the directory from which this tutorial has been opened. `[4: If you didn’t open the tutorial directly from the installation directory (e.g. via start menu), you may find the appropriate files in the Doxee Template Designer installation directory under Documentation\en\]` The directory contains two files – example.xml and example.xsd. The XML file contains the actual data. The XSD is not necessary; it can be used to display the logical structure of the data.

Create a new template first and save it locally. In case you saved the template to a directory different to the tutorial directory, please copy example.xml and example.xsd into the corresponding folder. Open the *Data Inputs View *or go to the *Data Inputs *node in the *Outline View *if you close it before. `[5: In case you closed the Data Inputs View before, it will appear as a node in the Outline View. In order to re-open the view, just right click on the node in the Outline View and select Open in separate view._ This feature isn’t limited to this node only, you can nearly select any node to be opened in a separate view. Just try it out yourself.]` Right click inside the just opened view or on the node and select the context menu item *Add new Data Input ![](data:image/png;base64,)*. A dialog opens, in which the configuration is done. Enter a name for the data input, e.g. xml1. Click the button next to the input field *Schema *and choose example.xsd. Add example.xml to the field *XML file*. `[6: For information about displaying paths from files already used, see the user guide]`

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Figure 6. Add data input*

The *Data Inputs View *now shows the data structure just added. Open the tree as shown in [Show data structure](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-template-designer-tutorial-dynamic-values-1#_bookmark18). Note that you can choose if you want to select from the schema (which is derived from the XSD file) or from the data sample (which shows the content of the XML file). The difference is that the schema always displays all defined nodes, while the content of the data sample depends on the specific sample and displays the actual contents. For example it could be possible that some customers don’t have a fax number and therefore that field could be completely missing in the sample, while a well-defined schema file contains all possibly available fields. Select the node *name *either from the schema or the data sample and drag it into the *Design Window*. A menu will pop up in which you select Dynamic Value.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Figure 7. Show data structure*

A new dynamic value which holds the XPath to the selected element is created immediately and you see a blue labelled placeholder as seen in [Dynamic Value added](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-template-designer-tutorial-dynamic-values-1#_bookmark19). Advanced users may want to apply further changes to the XPath expression. In order to do so, a simple double click on the dynamic value opens a dialog in which the expression can be edited.

Another, even more convenient way, to edit the XPath of any selected dynamic element is by opening the *XPath Editor *via *View &gt; XPath Editor*.

![](data:image/png;base64,)Figure 8. Dynamic Value added

Create a PDF preview. The PDF shows the name *John Doe*.

## Things to Try
- Enter multiple dynamic values and structure them using texts, tables and colours

- Add your own data and process them
